dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slinging the pack onto his back) Geez, I forgot how heavy these things are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabbing other gear) Okay, let's heat 'em up! They flip the power switches on their packs and draw their particle throwers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, throwers.  Set for full neutronas on stream. They switch on their throwers and turn to face the raging phantasms. SCOLERI BROTHERS They are just about to wipe out the Judge when a loud shout distracts them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!  Why don't you pick on someone your own size? The towering ghosts turn in a fury and raise their arms, ready to shoot lightning at their new adversaries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the others) On my signal, boys.  Open 'em up -- Now! They all pull their triggers and the wands EXPLODE with incredible powerful STREAMS OF ENERGY, doing even more damage to the courtroom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spengs, take the door.  Ray, let's try and work them down and into the corner. Working as a team, they gradually confine the Scoleri Brothers with the streams, forcing them closer and closer to the traps Ray has set out on the floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch it!  I'm coming under you, Pete. They circle around the two ghosts, prodding them with the streams while ducking the lightning bolts shooting from their fingers.  Finally, Ray sees his chance and pops open the traps which emit inverted pyramids of light energy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Steady -- watch your streams -- easy now -- Venky, bring him left -- Spengy, pull him down -- trapping -- trapping -- now! He stomps on a control pedal and the Scoleri Brothers are drawn into the traps which snap shut. INT.  COURTROOM - TRAPS - DAY LEDs on the outer casing start flashing, indicating the presence of a ghost inside each trap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (checking the trap) Occupado. INT.  COURTROOM - JUDGE - DAY (AFTER GHOST BATTLE) He sticks his head up slowly from behind the debris of his bench and looks around in total amazement. LOUIS He crawls out from under a chair.  Reporters and spectators get back on their feet and start buzzing about the incredible manifestation. PROSECUTOR She's lying on the floor, attended to by the Bailiff and the Court Clerk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Prosecutor) Brilliant summation. GHOSTBUSTERS They break into big smiles as photographers start snapping pictures of them standing in the wrecked courtroom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Case closed, boys.  We're back in business. The spectators cheer and applaud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it, honey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's that darn ghost again!  I don't know what to do anymore.  He just won't leave us alone.  I guess we'll just have to move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry.  We're not moving.  He is. He picks up the phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you going to call?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a wink) Ghostbusters. As he starts to dial, the CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal the Ghostbusters standing in the bedroom.  Their acting isn't much better than Louis and Janine's. GHOSTBUSTERS Stantz speaks directly TO the CAMERA.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Ray -- VENKMAN I'm Peter -- SPENGLER I'm Egon -- STANTZ And we're the ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (together) Ghostbusters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right -- Ghostbusters.  We're back and we're better than ever with twice the know-how and twice the particle-power to deal with all your supernatural elimination needs. During his speech, Winston can be seen in the b.g. pretending to trap the fake ghost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Careful, Winston.  He's a mean one. (TO CAMERA) And to celebrate our grand reopening, we're giving you twice the value with our special half-price 'Welcome Back' service plan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold on, Ray!  Half-price!  Have you gone crazy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess so, Pete, because that's not all. Tell them what else we've got, Egon. Spengler actually mouths everyone else's dialogue along with them, waiting for his cue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean the Ghostbusters hot beverage thermal mugs and free balloons for the kids? He holds up a mug and a limp, uninflated balloon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You bet. As Stantz wraps it up, SUPERS APPEAR at the bottom of the SCREEN: FULLY BONDED - FULLY LICENSED - SE HABLA ESPANOL.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So don't wait another minute.  Make your supernatural problem our supernatural problem. Call now, because we're still -- ALL (in unison, mechanically)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ready to believe you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, geez, smells like somebody took a really big -- He freezes. INT. OFFICE AREA - LOUIS'S POV Slimer, a spud-like green ghost, is hovering over Louis's desk, scarfing down Louis's bag lunch.  Slimer looks up and sees Louis. SLIMER AND LOUIS They both scream and run off in opposite directions. SLIMER He passes right through a wall and disappears. LOUIS He runs right into a wall, recovers and exits in a hurry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Help!  There's a thing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (checking his watch) You know he ran that last lap in under six minutes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If he wasn't dead he'd be an Olympic prospect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the client) Merry Christmas!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the manager) So will that be cash or a check?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Gotcha! DESK The trap pops open and shoots out a powerful cone of energy.  Slimer dodges it and escapes as a big section of the ceiling comes crashing down on Louis's desk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing the damage) Uh-oh. He slinks off, defeated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm looking for Dana Barrett.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Room 304 -- Restorations. (recognizing him) Hey!  Dr. Venkman -- 'World of the Psychic.' I'm a big, big fan.  That used to be one of my two favorite shows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flattered) Thanks.  What's the other one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Bass Masters.'  It's a fishing show.  Ever see it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, really great.  Take it easy. He exits. INT.  MUSEUM - RESTORATION STUDIO - DAY (MOMENTS LATER) Dana is working on a valuable Flemish still-life by Ver Meer.  Janosz is at the other end of the room, still working on the painting of Vigo. Venkman enters and sneaks up behind Dana.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at the Ver Meer) So this is what you do, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glad to see him) Oh, hello, Peter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're really good, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't paint it.  I'm just cleaning it. It's an original Ver Meer.  It's worth about ten million dollars. VIGO He turns his head and watches Venkman and Dana. VENKMAN Unaware that he's being watched, Venkman squints at the still life, holding up his thumb like he's seen artists do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know you can go to Art World and get these huge sofa-size paintings for about forty-five bucks. He starts looking around at the other artwork in the studio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure you didn't come here just to talk about art.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As a matter of fact, I stopped by to tell you that I haven't forgotten your problem and that we're still on the case. They are interrupted by the sudden appearance of Janosz.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling at Venkman) Dana, aren't you going to introduce me to your friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry.  This is Peter Venkman. Peter, Janosz Poha. Venkman warily shakes his hand, trying to size him up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (avoiding his gaze) Pleasure to meet you.  I've seen you on television.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How are you? (looking over at the Vigo painting) What's that you're working on, Johnny? Janosz winces at the nickname but lets it go.  Venkman and Dana cross to the Vigo painting.  Janosz steps protectively in front of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a painting I'm restoring for the new Byzantine exhibition.  It's a self-portrait of Prince Vigo, the Carpathian.  He ruled most of Carpathia and Moldavia in the 17th Century.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at the painting) Too bad for the Moldavians.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defensive) He was a very powerful magician.  A genius in many ways and quite a skilled painter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was also a lunatic and a genocidal madman. I hate this painting.  I've felt very uncomfortable since they brought it up from storage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, it's not the kind of thing you'd want to hang in the rec room.  You know what it needs? (picking up a brush) A fluffy little white kitten in the corner. Venkman reaches toward the painting, but Janosz grabs his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with forced good will) We don't go around altering valuable paintings, Dr. Venkman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'd make an exception in this case if I were you. Dana looks disapprovingly at Venkman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Janosz) I'll let you get back to it.  Nice meeting you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My pleasure. Venkman and Dana cross back to her workspace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidentially) I may be wrong, but I think you've got a little crush on this guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good-bye, Peter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dragging his feet) I'd like to stay, but I really don't have time to hang around here.  I'll call you. (calls out to Janosz) Later, Johnny! He exits. VIGO Vigo turns his head and follows Dana as she returns to her workbench. DANA She stops, vaguely aware of the movement, and looks up curiously at the painting.  As she starts to walk on, Vigo looks at her again, but Dana turns suddenly and catches the movement.  Frightened now, she hastily leaves the studio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh good, you're here.  Spengler and I have something really amazing to show you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Spengler) It's not that thing you do with your nostrils, is it? Stantz goes to the refrigerator, opens the freezer, rummages around among the TV dinners and frozen pizza and pulls out a slime specimen in a Tupperware container.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Venkman) We've been studying the stuff that we took from the subway tunnel. He pops the specimen jar in the microwave and lets it thaw for a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now you're going to eat it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm just restoring it to its normal state. He takes the specimen out of the microwave and pours some of it into a large Petri dish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now watch this. He leans over the specimen and starts shouting at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (simulating anger) You worthless piece of slime!! (as the slime starts to twitch and glow) You ignorant disgusting blob!! SPECIMEN It bubbles and swells, changing color with each insult.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You foul, obnoxious muck!! STANTZ He continues venting his rage on the slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've seen some real crud in my time, but you're a chemical disgrace!! The specimen doubles its size and starts spilling over the rim of the Petri dish. STANTZ AND SPENGLER They turn to Venkman for his reaction.  He's dumbfounded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is what you do with your spare time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very excited) This is an incredible breakthrough, Venkman. A psychoreactive substance!  Whatever this is, it clearly responds to human emotional states.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Mood slime.'  We ought to bottle this stuff and sell it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've found it at every event site we've been to lately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (poking at the slime) You mean this stuff actually feeds on 'bad vibes'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like a goat on garbage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're running tests to see if we can get an equally strong positive reaction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of tests?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a little embarrassed) Well, we sing to it, we talk to it, we say supportive, nurturing things -- VENKMAN You're not sleeping with this stuff, are you? Spengler reacts as if he might be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It really responds to music. (to Spengler) Let's calm it down. Spengler picks up a guitar and he and Stantz start singing "Cumbaya" to the slime specimen. SPECIMEN It stops bubbling and starts to shrink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does it have any favorites?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It likes all the sappy stuff: 'Cumbaya,' 'Everything is Beautiful,' 'It's a Small World' -- but it loves Jackie Wilson. Venkman and Winston watch intently as Spengler spoons some of the psych-reactive slime onto an old toaster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch this. Stantz turns on a CASSETTE PLAYER and Jackie Wilson's "HIGHER AND HIGHER" BLASTS from the speakers. TOASTER It shakes, spins and actually starts moving in time with the MUSIC. VENKMAN He stares in disbelief at the dancing toaster as it shoots two pieces of toast into the air and catches them without missing a beat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care what you say.  This could be a major Christmas gift item.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right, and the first time someone gets mad, their toaster will eat their hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So we'll put a warning on the label. Stantz turns OFF the MUSIC and the toaster stops moving.  Venkman looks at the toaster and sticks his fingers in the slot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the toaster) Go ahead.  I dare you. Suddenly, he yelps as if the toaster has actually bitten into his hand and won't let go.  The others jump in to help him, but Venkman laughs and easily withdraws his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just kidding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (talking sweetly to the baby) Look at you.  I think we got more food on your shirt than we got in your mouth. BATHTUB The water pouring from the faucet changes to slime and settles at the bottom of the tub.  Dana reaches over and turns off the water without looking into the tub.  When she turns away, both taps start to spin by themselves and the tub flexes and bulges. DANA Still unaware, she routinely reaches over and squirts some bubble bath into the tub. BATHTUB The rim of the tub puckers up and the sides convulse as if swallowing the bubble bath. DANA She picks the baby up off the bassinet and turns to place him in the tub. She is just about to lower him into the water when the tub starts to close up around the baby like a hugh mouth.  Dana screams, snatches the baby away and runs from the room clutching Oscar to her bosom as the bathtub convulses and vomits up buckets of slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (somewhat embarrassed to be there) I'm sorry.  Were you on your way out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised to see her) No, I just got in -- a couple hours ago. Come on in. (noting her apparel) Are we having a pajama party?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (upset) Peter, the bathtub tried to eat Oscar. Venkman looks at her for a long moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, if anyone else told me that, I'd have serious doubts.  But coming from you, I can't honestly say I'm surprised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I must be losing my mind.  At the museum today I could have sworn that terrible painting of Vigo looked right at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who could blame him?  Were you wearing this nightgown?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distraught) I don't know what to do anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get Ray and Egon to check out the bathtub.  You better stay here. He exits to the bathroom.  She looks around the loft, amazed at the disorder.  Venkman comes back immediately with an old sweatshirt and takes Oscar from her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now this kid has a serious nudity problem. He spreads the sweatshirt out on the sofa, lays the baby on it and starts tying it around him like a diaper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the baby) This is Joe Namath's old number, you know. You could get a lot of chicks with this. Just don't pee in it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peter, what about the bathtub?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabs the phone and dials) We'll take care of that. (on the phone) Ray, Pete.  Listen, get over to Dana's right away ... Her bathtub pulled a fast one -- tried to eat the kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was full of this awful pink ooze.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ray) Sounds like another slime job ... No, they're all right.  They're here now ... Right ... Let me know. He hangs up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're going over there right now.  You might as well make yourself at home.  Let me show you around. (he crosses to the kitchen area) This is the cuisine de maison -- It's an incredible mess. The sink is piled high with dirty dishes and the counters are littered with all sorts of food trash.  He grabs a big open Hefty bag on the floor and starts throwing garbage into it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at the sink) We may have to wash some of these if you get hungry -- (he looks in the fridge)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: but there's no food anyway so forget about it.  I have all kinds of carry-out menus if you feel like ordering. He opens a drawer full of pizza, barbecue and Chinese food menus, then crosses to the bathroom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bathroom's right here -- let me just tidy up a few things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peter, this is very nice, but you don't have to do any of this, you know. He goes into the bathroom and we hear WATER RUNNING, the TOILET FLUSHING and more items going into the Hefty bag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The shower works but it's a little tricky. They're both marked "Hot."  It takes a little practice, but at least this one won't try and eat you. He comes out of the bathroom with the now-loaded Hefty bag over his shoulder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be careful on that sofa -- it's a butt-biter. But the bed's good and I just changed the sheets so if you get tired, feel free.  In fact, I think you should definitely plan on spending the night here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really?  And how would we handle the sleeping arrangements?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For me it's best if I sleep on my side and you spoon up right behind me with your arms around me.  If we go the other way I'm afraid your hair will be getting in my face all night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about you on the sofa and me in bed with the baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or we could do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you. (she picks up Oscar) Poor baby.  I think I should put him down now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll put him down for you. (taking the baby) You are way too short!  And your belly-button sticks out!  You're nothing but a burden to your poor mother! Venkman carries the baby into the bedroom leaving Dana in the living room, feeling more relaxed and a lot safer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you find anything at Dana's?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.  Just some mood-slime residue in and around the bathtub.  But we did turn up some interesting stuff on this Vigo character you mentioned.  I found the name Vigo the Carpathian in Leon Zundinger's Magicians, Martyrs and Madmen.  Listen to this:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reads from xerox of entry) "Vigo the Carpathian, born 1505, died 1610 --" VENKMAN A hundred and five years?  He really hung on, didn't he.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And he didn't die of old age either.  He was poisoned, stabbed, shot, hung, stretched, disemboweled, drawn and quartered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess he wasn't too popular at the end there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, not exactly a man of the people. (reads) "Also known as Vigo the Cruel, Vigo the Torturer, Vigo the Despised, and Vigo the Unholy."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This guy was a bad monkey.  He dabbled in all the Black Arts, and listen to this prophecy.  Just before his head died, his last words were, "Death is but a door, time is but a window.  I'll be back."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it?  "I'll be back?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a rough translation from the Moldavian. They enter the museum carrying their monitoring equipment. INT.  MUSEUM - SECURITY DESK - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Rudy the guard looks up in surprise as the Ghostbusters enter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Dr. Venkman.  What's going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're just going up to Restorations for a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I can't let you do that.  Mr. Poha told me not to let you up there anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with mock seriousness) Okay, we were trying to keep this quiet but I think you can be trusted.  Tell him, Ray.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very official) Mister, you have an Ecto-paritic, subfusionary flux in this building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got a flux?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got a flux and a half.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now if you don't want to be the -- (he counts)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: fifth person ever to die in meta-shock from a planar rift, I suggest you get down behind that desk and don't move until we give you the signal "Stabilize -- All Clear." Rudy gulps and starts to hunker down behind the desk as the Ghostbusters head upstairs. INT.  MUSEUM - RESTORATION STUDIO - DAY (MOMENTS LATER) Janosz is working on the Vigo painting when the Ghostbusters enter.  He rushes over and stops them at the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Venkman?  Dana is not here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why have you come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got a major creep alert and we're just going down the list.  Your name was first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Spengler and Winston) Let's sweep it, boys. They deploy and start scanning the studio with their monitoring devices.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Janosz) You know, I never got to ask you.  Where you from, Johnny?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervous) The Upper West Side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (consulting his PKE meter) This entire room is extremely hot, Peter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What exactly are you looking for, Dr. Venkman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll know when we find it.  You just sit tight.  This won't take long. STANTZ Using the Giga-meter, he traces a strong psychomagnetheric reading to the painting of Vigo in the alcove at the end of the studio.  Venkman comes up behind him with Janosz right on his heels.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the one that looked at Dana.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It must be the chemical fumes in the studio. People start imagining things -- VENKMAN (interrupts) I'm going to rule out the glue-sniffing theory.  If she says it looked at her, it looked at her. (to Vigo) Hey, you!  Vigie!  Look at me.  I'm talking to you.  Hey!  Look at me when I'm talking to you. They watch the painting for any sign of movement. VIGO His eyes stare lifelessly into the distance. STANTZ AND VENKMAN Venkman starts shooting Polaroids of Vigo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Vigo) Beautiful, beautiful.  Work with me, baby. Just have fun with it. (to Stantz) Okay, he's playing it cool.  Let's finish up and get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get one more reading. Venkman walks off leaving Stantz alone with the painting.  Stantz scans the painting with the Giga-meter until his eyes meet Vigo's. VIGO His eyes seems to burn right through to the depths of Stantz's soul. STANTZ He stands there transfixed, unable to look away, as a strange and subtle transformation occurs within him.  Winston comes up behind him and breaks the spell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at the painting) Now that's one ugly dude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (coming back to his senses) Huh?  What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You finished here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distracted) What?  Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?  You coming down with something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm fine.  I just got light-headed for a second there.  Let's go. They head for the door. JANOSZ He escorts the Ghostbusters to the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you see, everything is in order, is it not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not.  Don't leave town and report any change in your address to the proper authorities. We'll be back. They exit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's definitely something going on in that studio.  The PKE levels were max-plus and the Giga-meter was showing all red.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd put my money on that Vigo character.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, that's a safe bet. (to Stantz) You and Spengman see what else you can dig up on Vigo and this little weasel Poha. Those two were made for each other. INT.  ECTO-2 - DAY (LATER) The Ghostbusters are driving back to the firehouse.  Stantz is at the wheel.  His eyes are vacant, he seems distracted and very tense.  Stantz swerves suddenly and HONKS the horn angrily.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to another driver) Idiot! (honking) Move it, you jerk! Venkman and Winston exchange surprised looks. EXT.  STREET - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Stantz drives extremely fast, HONKING vindictively, weaving dangerously through traffic. INT.  ECTO-2 - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Winston looks at Ray, concerned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Going a little fast, aren't we, Ray? Stantz turns on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (viciously) Are you telling me how to drive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I just thought -- STANTZ Well don't think! He HONKS again and tromps hard on the accelerator. EXT.  STREET - DAY (CONTINUOUS) Ecto-2 is now barreling down the avenue.  Pedestrians leap to safety as Stantz runs a red light. INT.  ECTO-2 - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) They hang on to the safety straps as Stantz continues his maniacal ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Stantz, really worried now) Are you crazy, man?  You're going to kill somebody! Stantz looks at him and smile demonically.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm going to kill everybody! He swerves off the road. EXT.  ECTO-2 - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) The car heads right for a big tree. INT.  ECTO-2 - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) At the last possible moment, Winston cold-cocks Stantz, grabs the wheel and steps across to stomp on the brakes. EXT.  ECTO-2 - DAY (CONTINUOUS ACTION) The car skids into the tree and stops.  The Ghostbusters stumble out dazed and shaken, but unhurt.  Stantz rubs his eyes and looks at the others, completely at a loss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (himself again) What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just picked up three penalty points on your driver's license.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I guess so.  It was the strangest thing.  I knew what I was doing but I couldn't stop.  This really terrible feeling came over me and -- I don't know -- I just felt like driving into that tree and ending it all.  Whew!  Sorry, boys. They inspect the damage to the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidentially, to Spengler) Watch him, Egon.  Don't even let him shave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calls out) I'm home! He looks around the large open loft.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to himself) I knew it.  She cleaned. He hears the SHOWER RUNNING and crosses to the bathroom.  The door is half-open and he can see Dana in the shower (tastefully blurred) through the transparent vinyl curtain.  He closes the bathroom door and looks at the baby asleep on the bed, surrounded by pillows to prevent him rolling off.  Then he turns and bumps into Dana who's just coming out of the bathroom wrapped in a towel.  She jumps back into the bathroom. She comes out again, this time wearing a robe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all squeaky clean now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (humoring him) Yes, I'm very clean.  Did they find anything at my apartment? She squeezes past him into the bedroom and closes the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through the door) Nothing.  They stayed there all night, went through your personal stuff, made a bunch of long-distance phone calls and cleaned out your refrigerator.  And didn't find anything. Dana opens the bedroom door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They didn't find anything?  In the bathtub ... the pink ooze ... nothing?  So, what do I do now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you get dressed and we go out.  I got a babysitter and everything.  Trust me, you need it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not here to date.  I can't leave Oscar in a strange place with someone I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's Janine Melnitz, from my staff.  She's one of my most valuable employees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does she know anything about babies?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Janine Melnitz, are you kidding? (handing her the flowers) Do I have a vase?  I brought some of your clothes.  Wear something intriguing.  I brought along some interesting possibilities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, but it's not a date.  It's a dinner. She smiles and closes the door again.  He opens the closet and starts looking for his good suit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you happen to see some shirts on the floor in here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I put them in your hamper.  I thought they were dirty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) I have a hamper?  Next time ask me first, okay.  I have more than two grades of laundry.  There're lots of subtle levels between clean and dirty. He pulls some clothes out of the hamper and inspects them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These aren't so bad yet.  You just hang them up for a while and they're fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to himself) Okay, Stinky, this is it.  Showdown time. You and me, pal.  You think you're smarter than I am?  We'll see about that. (loud) Oh, hello, Pizza Man!  Oh, two larges!  I only ordered one.  Oh, pepperoni and pineapple.  My absolute favorite.  I guess I'll have to eat these both by myself. THE CEILING Slimer pokes his head through the ceiling and scans the room hanging upside down. LOUIS He spots Slimer through the rearview mirror.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Okay, let's boogie! He whirls around and fires a proton stream at Slimer, slicing a burning a gash across the ceiling. THE STAIRS Janine comes up and ducks as a bolt of energy streaks across the room and strikes the wall behind her.  Slimer disappears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (embarrassed and apologetic) Oh migod!  I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to do that.  It was an accident.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing up here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was trying to get that smelly green thing. The guys asked me to help out.  I'm like the fifth Ghostbuster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would you want to be a Ghostbuster if you're already an accountant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no, it's just if one of the guys calls in sick or gets hurt. Louis quickly slips off the proton pack and sets it down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you made any plans yet?  You know tomorrow is New Year's Eve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I celebrate at the beginning of my corporate tax year which is March first. That way I beat the crowds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's very practical.  I hate going out on New Year's Eve, too. There is an awkward silence between them and Janine starts to leave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, good night, Louis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on an impulse) Janine, do you feel like maybe getting something to eat on the way home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to, but I told Dr. Venkman I'd babysit. (seductively) Do you want to babysit with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, sure, that sounds great. They exit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ushering them in) Don't tell me, let me guess.  All-you-can-eat barbecue rib night at the Sizzler?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going down into the sewer system to see if we can trace the source of the psycho-reactive slime flow.  We thought you might want to come along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Darn it!  I wish I'd known you were going. I'm stuck with these damn dinner reservations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, animals and lower life forms often anticipate major disasters.  Given the new magnetheric readings we could see a tremendous breeding surge in the cockroach population.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Roach breeding?  Sounds better and better. (calls out) Dana?  The boys are going down under the sewers tonight to look for slime.  Egon thinks there might even be some kind of big roach-breeding surge.  Should we forget about dinner and go with them instead? Dana steps into the living room looking very beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow. Dana looks curiously at their outfits.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi. They nod and wave back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ray and Egon) I think we're going to have to pass on the sewer trip, boys.  Let me know what you find out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on his exit) Okay, but you're missing all the fun. INT.  VAN HORNE STATION - NIGHT (LATER) Stantz, Spengler and Winston come down the stairs into the station, guided by a very old map of the underground city.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is it.  Van Horne Station.  Right where the old transit map said it would be. They cross to the edge of the platform and look into the river of slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's get a sounding on the depth of that flow. Stantz has a long, coiled, graduated cord with a plumb bob on the end of it attached to his utility belt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stand back. He takes the cord in his hand, swings the plumb bob over his head and casts it out into the middle of the flow.  The plumb bob sinks and Spengler reads the depth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six feet -- seven -- eight -- STANTZ That's it.  It's on the bottom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nine feet -- ten -- WINSTON Is the line sinking?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, the slime is rising. Stantz looks down and notices the slime rising over the edge of the platform and around his boots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (alarmed) Let's get out of here, boys. He starts to pull out the plumb line but it seems to be stuck. Spengler tries to help, but whatever is pulling on the cord is stronger than all three of them.  As their unseen adversary pulls them closer and closer to the edge, Stantz works desperately to unhook the cord from his belt but finally just unhooks the whole belt.  Spengler lets go in time but Winston doesn't.  He is jerked off his feet and into the slime flow. Stantz and Spengler look at each other, summon their courage and jump in after him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very intimate) Here's to -- us. She sighs and drinks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So -- are you making any New Year's resolutions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to stop getting involved with men who aren't good for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does that start exactly at midnight tomorrow, or could you hold off for a few days maybe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For one night in your life, do you think it's possible for us to be completely real?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, you want to be real?  So tell me why did you dump me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Peter, I didn't dump you.  I just had to protect myself.  You really weren't very good for me, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not even good for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you say things like that?  You're so much better than you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.  If I had that kind of support on a daily basis, I could definitely shape up by the turn of the century.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (already feeling the effects of the champagne) So why don't you give me a jingle in the year 2000?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me jingle you right now. He leans over to kiss her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I should call Janine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry.  Janine has a very special way with children. They kiss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking around) I can't believe a person could actually live like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the baby) So these dwarfs had a limited partnership in a small mining operation and then one day a beautiful princess came to live with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's really not a bad place.  It just needs a woman's touch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) So they bartered room and board in exchange for housekeeping services, which was a good deal for all of them because then they didn't have to withhold tax and social security, which I'm not saying is right but it's just a story, so I guess it's all right.  I can finish this later if you're tired. Louis goes into the bedroom and puts the baby down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're really good with children, Louis.  I can tell. (as he returns) Why don't you come here and sit with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. He sits stiffly beside her on the sofa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting close) Motherhood is a very natural instinct for me.  I'd like to have a baby myself. Wouldn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gulps) Tonight? EXT.  STREET - MANHOLE COVER - NIGHT (SAME TIME) A manhole cover is dislodged and pushed up from below.  It slides away, and Winston crawls out of the manhole followed by Stantz and Spengler. They are exhausted and covered with slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uncharacteristically angry) Nice going, Ray!  What were you trying to do -- drown me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (unusually mean) Look, Zeddemore, it wasn't my fault you were too stupid to drop that line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shoves him) You better watch your mouth, man, or I'll punch your lights out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah?  Anytime, anytime.  Just go ahead and try it. Spengler steps between them with unprecedented aggression.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you two are looking for a fight, you got one. (putting up his fists) Who wants it first?  Come on, Ray.  Try me, sucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (squaring off) Butt out, you pencil-necked geek.  I've had it with you. They grab each other and start to tussle.  Suddenly Spengler comes to his senses and pulls them apart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forcefully) Strip!  Right now!  Get out of those clothes! He starts yanking off his slicker and waders.  Bewildered, Stantz and Winston start doing the same.  Spengler helps pull off their clothes and throws them into the open manhole.  Now wearing only long underwear, they seem to return to normal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are we doing?  Ray, I was ready to kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you see?  It's the slime.  That stuff is like pure, concentrated evil. Stantz looks around and sees that they are standing right in front of the museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it's all flowing right to this spot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intercepting them) Can I help you? Stantz looks around and spots Venkman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right, I see him. They blow right by the Maitre d' who jumps back in horror as they pass. VENKMAN He's just about to pour more champagne when he sees Ray, Egon and Winston coming toward him through the restaurant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very excited) You should've been there, Venkman. Absolutely incredible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, sorry I missed it. (noting their attire) I guess you guys didn't know about the dress code here.  It's really kind of a coat and tie place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all over the city, Pete -- well, under it actually.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rivers of the stuff!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it's all flowing toward the museum. He gestures excitedly and a big gob of slime flies across the room and lands on a well-dressed diner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calls out) Sorry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we should discuss this somewhere else. Venkman notes the look of alarm on Dana's face and pulls his colleagues aside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidentially) Boys, listen.  You're scaring the straights. Let's save this until tomorrow, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Venkman) This won't wait until tomorrow, Venkman. It's hot and it's ready to pop. MAITRE D' He hurries through the restaurant with two city COPS right behind him and makes straight for Venkman's table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Arrest these men.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (recognizing them) Hey!  It's the Ghostbusters.  You're out of uniform, gentlemen Stantz suddenly realizes how ridiculous they look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (self-conscious) Uh -- well -- we had a little accident, but forget that.  We have to see the mayor as soon as possible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Doc, why don't you just go home. You'll get a good night's sleep and then you can give the mayor a call in the morning. Come on. He takes Stantz by the arm but Stantz resists.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're not going anywhere with you.  I told you we have to see the mayor now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabbing Stantz) I'm warning you.  You can come along peaceably or -- VENKMAN (grabs the Cop) Hey, don't be an idiot.  This is serious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angry) Look, pal, keep this up and you're going with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (has had enough) Yeah, let's go.  You're all under arrest. The Cop catches Venkman in an armlock and starts walking him out of the restaurant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Dana) Finish your dessert -- it's already paid for.  I'll call you. They all exit, causing a major commotion among the other diners. EXT.  ARMAND'S RESTAURANT - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) The police car is parked right behind Ecto-2.  Spengler stops at the police car and confronts the cops.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, we're not drunk and we're not crazy. This is a matter of vital importance. Venkman steps in and looks at the policemen's nametags.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just want to get your names right for when the mayor asks us why we didn't let him know about this sooner. The Cops look at each other, uncertain about what to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relenting) Okay, Doc.  You want to see the mayor, you got it.  Follow us. They head for their respective vehicles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (embarrassed) Oh, hello, Dana.  we were just -- we were -- DANA I know what you were doing, Louis.  It's all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How was your date?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Typical.  Peter was arrested.  Has he called?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, nobody called. Dana frowns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is everything all right with Oscar?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he's fine.  He's such a good baby.  He was a little fussy at first, but we gave him a Freach bread pizza and he went right to sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relieved) Oh, good.  I'll just check on him. She crosses to the bedroom. INT.  VENKMAN'S BEDROOM - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Dana looks at Oscar sleeping peacefully on the bed.  She starts to change clothes. INT.  VENKMAN'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT (SAME TIME) Louis and Janine aren't sure what to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Should we go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think we should leave her alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right.  We should stay. He grabs Janine and they start making out again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vigo, the scourge of Carpathia -- JANOSZ (heard all this before) Yes, the scourge -- VIGO -- the sorrow of Moldavia -- JANOSZ -- the sorrow -- VIGO I command you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (checking his watch) I await the word of Vigo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The season of evil begins with the birth of the new year.  Bring me the child that I might live again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (abjectly humble) Lord Vigo, the mother, Dana, is fine and strong.  I was wondering -- well, would it be possible -- if I bring the baby, could I have the woman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So be it.  On this the day of darkness, she will be ours, wife to you and mother to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right -- the Ghostbusters.  I'll tell you right now; I've got two hundred of the heaviest campaign contributors in the city out there eating bad roast chicken waiting for me to give the speech of my life. You've got two minutes.  Make it good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You get enough negative energy flowing in a dense environment like Manhattan, it starts to build up, and if we don't do something fast this whole place will blow like a frog on a hotplate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him about the toaster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think he's ready for the toaster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) Being miserable and treating other people like dirt is every New Yorker's God-given right.  What am I supposed to do -- go on television and tell eight million people they have to be nice to each other?  I'm sorry, none of this makes any sense to me, and if anything does happen we've got plenty of paid professionals to deal with it.  Your two minutes are up.  Good night, gentlemen. The mayor exits, leaving the Ghostbusters to Hardemeyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smirking) That's quite a story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I think the Times might be interested, don't you?  The Post might have a lot of fun with it, too. Hardemeyer's eyes go cold and calculating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Before you go running to the newspapers with this, would you consider telling this slime thing to some people downtown?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you're talking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (protesting) I'm telling you, we're not crazy.  He is! HARDEMEYER He laughs off the remark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Psychiatrist) The mayor wants them kept under strict observation for a few days.  We think they're seriously disturbed and potentially dangerous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll do whatever's necessary. Hardemeyer shakes his hand and exits as the door slams shut on the Ghostbusters. INT.  VENKMAN'S LOFT - NIGHT (SAME TIME) Louis and Janine are watching an old rerun on TV, eating popcorn, while Dana is stretched out on the other sofa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wishing they'd leave) You know you really don't have to stay. Peter should be back soon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, we don't mind. She hears a little CRY from the nursery and sits up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me.  I think Oscar is up. She crosses to the bedroom. INT.  VENKMAN'S BEDROOM - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Dana enters and immediately notices that the crib is empty and the window is open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) Louis! Frantic now, Dana rushes to the window and looks out, as Louis and Janine come running in. EXT.  WINDOW LEDGE - DANA'S POV - NIGHT (ECLIPSE) The baby is standing out on the ledge at the corner of the building, fifty feet above the street, staring off into the distance as if he's waiting for something. EXT.  WINDOW LEDGE - NIGHT (ECLIPSE) (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Dana climbs out onto the ledge and starts inching slowly toward the baby. Then she stops as a miraculous apparition materializes. LOUIS AND JANINE They lean out the window, gaping at the apparition. EXT.  VENKMAN'S LEDGE - APPARITION A sweet, kindly-looking English nanny appears, pushing a pram, strolling on thin air parallel to the ledge high above the ground.  Her face looks remarkably like Janosz Poha's.  The nanny extends her hand to the BABY who GURGLES sweetly as he reaches out to take it. DANA She watches in helpless horror.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) No!! GHOST NANNY She picks up the baby and lays it gently in the pram, then turns and smiles at Dana.  The smile turns to a hideous grin, then the nanny shrieks at Dana and takes off like a shot with the baby. DANA She watches the creature fly off with Oscar, then climbs back through the window assisted by Louis and Janine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (resolutely) Louis, you have to find Peter and tell him what happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused and worried) Where're you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To get my baby back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We think the spirit of Vigo the Carpathian is alive in a painting at the Manhattan Museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see. And are there any other paintings in the museum with bad spirits in them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatient) You're wasting valuable time!  We have reason to believe that Vigo is drawing strength from a psychomagnetheric slime flow that's been collecting under the city.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, tell me about the slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's potent stuff.  We made a toaster dance with it, then a bathtub tried to eat his friend's baby. The psychiatrist looks at Venkman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't look at me.  I think they're nuts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I knew you would come. Startled, Dana turns at the sound of his voice as Janosz steps out from behind the Vigo painting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defiantly) What do you want with my baby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No harm will come to the child.  You might even say it's a privilege.  He will be the vessel for the spirit of Vigo.  And you -- well, you will be the mother of the ruler of the world.  Doesn't that sound nice?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If this is what the world will be like, I don't want to live in it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidentially, indicating Vigo) I don't believe we have the luxury of choice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody has a choice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not in this case, my dear.  Take a look. That's not Gainsborough's Blue Boy up there. He's Vigo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care who he is.  He's not taking my baby. Dana walks quickly to the door but suddenly Oscar flies out of her arms, floats across the room and lands lightly back in the cradle. DANA She turns and looks at Vigo, for the first time feeling his power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will see.  It's all for the best.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is it. boys.  It's starting.  Shit-storm
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Venkman is doing occupational therapy, weaving on a little hand-loom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It better not start yet.  I'm trying to finish my potholder before lunch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think all those predictions about the world coming to an end in the 1990s are true? A PATIENT at the next table joins the discussion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with certainty)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .  My dog told me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of dog?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Labrador.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) Habitual liars.  They can't help it.  It's in the breed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Sherm.  You're my cousin.  Do this for me.  I'm begging you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do it, Louis.  It isn't ethical.  I could lose my license.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't you just have them released? You're a doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a dermatologist.  I can't write orders on the psych ward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sherman, I've done lots of favors for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got you out of those bad tax shelters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were the one who got me in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I fixed you up with Diane Troxler and she put out, didn't she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I had to give her free dermabrasion for a year.  Forget it, Louis.  I could get in a lot of trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling you, we're all going to be in big trouble if we don't do something fast. That ghost guy came and took my friend's baby and we got to get it back.  It's just a scared little baby, Sherm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you should go to the police.  I don't believe in any of that stuff. Sherman looks out the window. EXT.  SKY - SHERMAN'S POV The sky begins to go dark as the sun is magically eclipsed. INT.  EXAMINING ROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION - DAY The room goes dark.  Louis switches on a lamp which casts an eerie light on his face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (spooky) Do you believe it now, Sherm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrewish) I told you we should have stayed in Palm Beach.  The weather here gets stranger every year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, dear. She doesn't notice it, but a small amount of slime falls on the back of her luxurious, full-length, white mink coat.  The doorman nods courteously and extends a hand to help her up the stairs. WOMAN She yelps in pain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the doorman) Something just bit me! The doorman looks curiously at her, then recoils in shock as her coat comes alive.  MINK HEADS pop out of the thick fur, SNARLING, BARKING and YAPPING, their sharp, little teeth biting the air.  Reacting quickly, the doorman yanks the coat off the woman's back, throws it to the ground and starts stomping on it as the Woman and her husband look on in horror. The coat scuttles down the steps and runs off down the street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on the phone) Look, lady, of course there are dead people there.  It's a cemetery ... (his face falls) They were asking you for directions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on another phone) Was this a big dinosaur or a little dinosaur? ... Oh, just the skeleton, huh?  Well, where is it now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on the phone) Wait a second -- the park bench was chasing you?  You mean, someone was chasing you in the park ... No, the bench itself was chasing you.  I see -- A weary SERGEANT answers a RINGING PHONE.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Manhattan Central, Flaherty speaking ... Yeah ... yeah? ... What?  Who is this? ... Wait a second. He puts the caller on "Hold" and turns the LIEUTENANT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant, I think you better talk to this guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on another call) What is it?  I'm talkin' here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's some dock supervisor down at Pier 34 on the Hudson.  The guy's going nuts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes a deep breath) He says the Titanic just arrived. INT.  PORT AUTHORITY OFFICE - NIGHT (ECLIPSE) The dock supervisor stands there with the phone in his hand, an assistant beside him, both staring out the window at the ocean liner tied up at the pier. EXT.  PIER 34 - THEIR POV - NIGHT (ECLIPSE) The name "R.M.S. Titanic" is clearly visible on the side of the huge ship.  The gangplank is down and dozens of drowned passengers, sopping wet and festooned with seaweed, are disembarking while drowned porters off-load their waterlogged baggage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good work, Louis.  How did you get us out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I pulled a few strings.  I wouldn't want to say any more than that. Louis winks conspiratorially at Sherman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is my cousin Sherman.  Sherm, say hello to the Ghostbusters. (sotto voce to Stantz) I promised him a ride in the car if he got you out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Ghostbusters) Hi, it's really great to meet you guys.  I know this sounds weird but once I had a dream that my grandfather was standing at the foot of my bed, but I knew it was impossible because he died and he started to tell me that -- While he's talking, the Ghostbusters jump in the Ectomobile and drive off, leaving him and Louis standing at the curb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!  Wait!  Okay, I'll meet you there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you were like the fifth Ghostbuster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I let them handle all the little stuff.  I just come in on the big ones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, they still think you're crazy, but I convinced them you're not dangerous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (determined) Yeah, well guess again. EXT.  BELLEVUE HOSPITAL - NIGHT (ECLIPSE)(MOMENTS LATER) Ecto-2 is parked outside and the Ghostbusters are hastily donning their standard uniforms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I brought everything you asked for and I gassed up the car with Super Unleaded.  It cost twenty cents more than Regular Unleaded but you get much better performance and in an old car like this that'll end up saving you money in the long run.  I put it on my credit card, so you can either reimburse me or I can take it out of petty cash -- While he's talking, the Ghostbusters jump in the Ecto-2 and drive off without him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!  Wait!  Okay, I'll meet you there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like a giant Jello mold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate Jello. They stride manfully across the street and approach the main entrance to the museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Fire Captain) Okay, give it a rest, Captain.  We'll take it from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (skeptical) Be my guest.  We been cutting here for three hours.  What the hell's going on?  You know the Titanic arrived this morning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, better late than never. The workmen and firemen put down their tools and fall back as the Ghostbusters draw their particle throwers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (monitoring valences) Full neutronas, maser assist. They adjust their settings and prepare to fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Throw 'em! They trigger their throwers and spray the front doors of the building with bolts of proton energy, but it has no effect on the hardened slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the firemen) Okay, who knows "Cumbaya?" A few of the firemen and workmen tentatively raise their hands.  Venkman grabs them and lines them up at the entrance of the museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.  Nice and sweet -- (starts singing) Cumbaya, milord, cumbaya -- Stantz, Spengler, Winston and the firemen sing along, reluctantly holding hands and swaying to the music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) Cumbaya, milord, cumbaya, Cumbaya, milord, cumbaya, Oh, Lord, cumbaya. Stantz inspects the wall of slime with his infra-goggles and finds that they have only managed to open a hole the size of a dime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it.  The Vienna Boys Choir couldn't get through this stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good effort.  Now what?  Should we say supportive, nurturing things to it, Ray?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It won't work.  There's no way we could generate enough positive energy to crack that shell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe things have gotten so bad in this city that there's no way back. Sure, it's crowded, it's dirty, it's noisy. And there are too many people who'd just as soon step on your face as look at you.  But there've got to be a few sparks of sweet humanity left in this burned-out burg.  We just have to mobilize it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need something that everyone can get behind, a symbol -- His eyes fall on ECTO-2's New York State license plate which features a line drawing of the Statue of Liberty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he sees it, too) Something that appeals to the best in each and every one of us -- SPENGLER Something good -- VENKMAN And pure -- WINSTON And decent. EXT.  THE STREET - NIGHT (SAME TIME) There is a commotion among the crowd as the Mayor's limousine arrives with a police escort.  Jack Hardemeyer steps out followed by the Mayor himself and they cross to the museum entrance. Hardemeyer, his ASSISTANT and several police BODYGUARDS confront the Ghostbusters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I've had it with you.  Get your stuff together, get back in that clown car and get out of here.  This is a city matter and everything's under control.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you think so?  Well, I've got news for you.  You've got Dracula's brother-in-law in there and he's got my girlfriend and her kid.  Around about midnight tonight, when you're partying uptown, this guy's going to come to life and start doing amateur head transplants.  And that's just round one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you telling me there're people trapped in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to his assistant) This is dynamite.  Call A.P., U.P.I., and C.N.N. and get them down here right away. When the police bring this kid out I want them to hand it right to the mayor and I want it all on camera.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Mayor, if we don't do something by midnight, you're going to go down in history as the man who let New York get sucked down into the tenth level of hell. The Mayor stops to consider the situation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Fire Captain) Can you get into that museum?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I had a nuclear warhead, maybe. The Mayor turns to Venkman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know why all these things are happening?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We tried to tell you last night, but Mr. Hard-On over here packed us off to the loony bin. Hardemeyer flips out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is preposterous!  You can't seriously believe all this mumbo-jumbo!  It's the Twentieth Century, for crying out loud! (viciously, to Venkman) Look, mister, I don't know what this stuff is or how you got it all over the museum, but you better get it off and I mean right now! He pounds the wall of slime with his fist, and they all watch in amazement as his fist goes through the wall and he is sucked bodily through the slime curtain.  Only his shoes can be seen, embedded in the slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Venkman) Okay, just tell me what you need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kind of makes you wonder, doesn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wonder what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If she's naked under that toga.  She's French, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing under that toga but 300 tons of iron and steel. Stantz is looking worried.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope we have enough stuff to do the job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only one way to find out. (to Stantz) Ready, Teddy? They enter the statue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, boys.  Let's frost it. They begin hosing the inside of the statue with the psycho-reactive slime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure this is such a good idea?  Do they know you're doing this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah, sure -- no.  But there's really not much to do here and they might need some back-up at the museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're very brave, Louis.  Good luck. She kisses Louis and he gets extremely self-conscious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh -- oh -- well, I better hurry. He rushes out. EXT  STREET OUTSIDE FIREHOUSE - NIGHT (LITTLE LATER) Louis stands on the street corner waiting for a bus.  Finally, a bus pulls up, Louis climbs aboard and finds Slimer behind the wheel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all yours, Pete. (checks his watch) There's not much time left. Venkman plugs the speaker cable into a Walkman and gives a downbeat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (giving the downbeat) Okay, one, two, three, four -- He hits "Play" on the Walkman and "HIGHER AND HIGHER" BOOMS from the huge SPEAKERS, amplified by the statue's vast hollow interior. INT.  OBSERVATION DECK - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) The head of the statue lurches suddenly, but the Ghostbusters cling to the rail and manage to keep their feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's moving!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've lived in New York all my life and I never visited the Statue of Liberty.  Now I finally get here and we're taking her out for a walk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading the Giga-meter) We've got full power. Stantz picks up a Nintendo control paddle from a home video game and starts pushing the buttons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into a microphone) Okay, Libby.  Let's get it in gear. They feel a strong vibration and the statue starts to move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How deep does it get?  That water's cold and I can't swim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay.  I have my Senior Lifesaving card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With a water temperature of forty degrees we'd survive approximately fifteen minutes. Stantz studies a maritime navigational chart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll keep to the middle of the channel. We're okay to 59th Street, then we'll go ashore and take First Avenue to 79th.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you kidding?  We'll hit all that bridge traffic at 59th.  I'm going to take 72nd straight up to Fifth.  Trust me, I used to drive a cab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Time is running out, Dana.  Soon it will be midnight and the city will be mine -- and Vigo's.  Well, mainly Vigo's.  But we have a spectacular opportunity to make the best of our relationship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't have a relationship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.  Marry me, Dana, and together we will raise Vigo as our son.  There are many perks that come with being the mother of a living god.  I'm sure he will supply for us a magnificent apartment.  And perhaps a car and free parking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate and despise you and everything you stand for with all my heart and soul.  I could never forgive what you've done to me and my child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Many marriages begin with a certain amount of distance, but after a while I believe we could learn to love each other.  Think about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd rather not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's working.  The positive GeV's are climbing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (patting the Statue) They love you, Lib.  Keep it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So far so good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (worried) I'm worried.  The vibrations could shake her to pieces.  We should have padded her feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think they make Nikes in her size.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're almost there, Lib. (to Stantz) Step on it. EXT.  STREET - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) The Statue's huge foot comes down and squashes a car. INT.  OBSERVATION DECK - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) The Ghostbusters look down at the flattened car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts out the window) My Fault!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) She's new in town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chanting) Ten .. nine ... eight ... seven ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Soon my life begins.  Then woe to the weak, all power to me, the world is mine. INT.  MUSEUM - JANOSZ - NIGHT The baby's body begins to glow as Vigo reaches out for it.  Then suddenly a dark shadow falls across the skylight.  Janosz looks up. INT.  MUSEUM - JANOSZ'S POV - SKYLIGHT - NIGHT The Statue of Liberty is looming over the skylight looking down on Janosz with an expression of righteous anger on it's face. EXT.  MUSEUM - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Kneeling beside the museum, the statue draws back it's mighty right arm and smashes the skylight with its torch. INT.  RESTORATION STUDIO - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Janosz retreats from the shower of broken glass as the Ghostbusters come sliding down ropes into the studio and confront Janosz with their new weapons.  Quick as a flash, Dana seizes the moment, dashes across the studio and snatches the baby from Vigo's outstretched arms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Janosz) Happy New Year. INT.  MUSEUM - VIGO PAINTING - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Vigo bellows in rage. INT.  MUSEUM - STUDIO - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS ACTION) Janosz steps in front of the painting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi there.  Feel free to try something stupid. Janosz sneers, trusting the invincibility of Vigo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You pitiful, miserable creatures!  You dare to challenge the power of darkness?  Don't you realize what you are dealing with?  He's Vigo!  You are like the buzzing of flies to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) Oh, Johnny.  Did you back the wrong horse. With that, the Ghostbusters fire their slime-blowers and hose Janosz from head to toe, blowing him into the corner.  Then they turn to Vigo. VIGO He is now almost completely out of the painting, but still held from the knees down.  He spits and rages at the Ghostbusters, trying to unleash his magic powers. THE GHOSTBUSTERS They stand fast, secure in the knowledge that Vigo's power has been neutralized by the good will of the people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vigi, Vigi, Vigi -- you have been a bad little monkey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The whole city's together on this one.  We took a vote.  Everybody's down on you, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (arming his slime-blower) Say goodnight now. Suddenly Vigo grabs Stantz by the neck and holds him up as a shield.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't shoot!  You'll hit Ray!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (strangling) Do it!  Just do it! Winston fires and hoses both Vigo and Ray. VIGO He bellows and drops Ray, then falls back into the painting. INT.  MUSEUM - PAINTING - NIGHT The paint turns liquid, melts off the canvas and runs onto the floor revealing another painting underneath it. INT.  MUSEUM - GHOSTBUSTERS - NIGHT (AFTER BATTLE) Venkman, Spengler and Winston rush over to Ray and kneel beside him.  He is completely covered with slime and motionless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (examining him) He's breathing. Winston wipes the slime off Ray's face and Ray opens his eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ray -- Ray -- How do you feel, man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles lovingly) Groovy.  I've never felt better in my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no.  We've got to live with this? They pull him to his feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you guys.  You're the best friends I've ever had. He hugs them each in turn, leaving them slimed as well.  Venkman recoils in disgust.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I just had this suit cleaned. (indicating Janosz) Take care of the wiggler, will you. Venkman crosses to Dana who is snuggling the baby.  She hugs Venkman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this -- a love in? (notes the symbols painted on the baby's body) Hey, sailor.  I think the tattoos are a little much, don't you? He picks up the baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Venkman) I think he likes you.  I think I do too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finally came to your senses, huh? They hug and kiss. SPENGLER, WINSTON AND STANTZ They help Janosz to his feet.  He's dazed but unhurt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (restored to normalcy) What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) Sir, you had a violent, prolonged, transformative psychic episode.  But it's over now.  Want a coffee?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (extremely nice) That's very kind of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Stantz) He's fine, Ray.  Physically intact, psychomagnetherically neutral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that good?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's where you want to be. As they exit they stop to examine the painting that was concealed by Vigo's self-portrait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Late Renaissance, I think.  Caravaggio or Brunelleschi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at it) There's something very familiar about this painting. INT.  MUSEUM - NEW PAINTING - NIGHT It's a beautiful painting in the high-Renaissance style depicting four archangels hovering protectively over a cherubic baby.  One holds a harp, one, an olive branch, the third, a book, and the last, a sword.  Most remarkably, their faces bear an uncanny resemblance to Venkman, Stantz, Spengler and Winston.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Slimer) Okay, so Monday night we'll get something to eat and maybe go bowling?  Can you bowl with those little arms? SLIMER GRUNTS and SLOBBERS a reply, flexing his scrawny biceps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, I have to go save Dana.  I'll see you later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Am I too late?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you're right on time. Stantz pops the cork on a bottle of champagne and hands it to him. EXT.  MUSEUM ENTRANCE - NIGHT (SAME TIME) Hardemeyer staggers out of the museum covered in slime.  He looks at the celebrating crowd and his eyes fill with tears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weepy) Happy New Year, everybody! He joins in on "Auld Lang Syne."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's all right.  She's just sleeping it off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stricken) We just had it restored.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This probably isn't a good time to bring this up, but the last time we did a job for the city you stiffed us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (handing the Mayor an invoice) This is a bill for tonight's job. The Mayor looks at it and gasps at the amount.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What!  This is way too much. (hands the bill back to Venkman) We won't pay. Venkman looks at the Statue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Stantz) I think she looks pretty good here, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, and a lot easier to get to than that island. Realizing he has no alternative, the Mayor sighs and takes the bill back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking up at the statue)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (musing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a similarly reflective mood)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My people weren't taking any pictures from those slave ships, man.  And there wasn't any Statue in Charleston Harbor to welcome them, either.  What are you, Dana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Blue Blood?  Her family's been here since the year 12.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not true.  It was 1620.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Same difference.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's your story, Pete?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me?  I'm a little of everything.  Some Irish, some German, some French, Dutch -- the women in my family slept around.  And that's what made this country great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a terrible thing to say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what?  It's a free country. (looking up at the Statue) Thanks, Lib. They all look up at the Statue. EXT.  STATUE OF LIBERTY - HEAD OF STATUE - DAY Slimer flies out one of the observation windows, THEME MUSIC KICKS IN and the CAMERA PULLS UP and AWAY FROM the island TO a HIGH SHOT of the Statue, lower Manhattan and the shining sea beyond.
dialogue.name: dialogue
